contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|top secret}} '''[[Top Secret]]''' generally refers to the highest acknowledged level of classified information. '''Top Secret''' may also refer to: {{TOC right}} == Film and television == * [[Top Secret (1952 film)|''Top Secret'' (1952 film)]], a British comedy directed by Mario Zampi * ''[[Top Secret!]]'', a 1984 American comedy starring Val Kilmer * [[Top Secret (House)|"Top Secret" (''House'')]], an episode of ''House'' * [[Top Secret (TV series)|''Top Secret'' (TV series)]], a 1961 British series starring William Franklyn * ''[[The Billionaire]]'', known in Thailand as ''Top Secret วัยรุ่นพันล้าน'' == Games and gaming == * [[Top Secret (arcade game)|''Top Secret'' (arcade game)]] or ''Bionic Commando'', a 1987 action platform game * [[Top Secret (role-playing game)|''Top Secret'' (role-playing game)]], a 1980 espionage-themed role-playing game * [[Top Secret (magazine)|''Top Secret'' (magazine)]], a Polish video game magazine * ''Top Secret'', an experimental multiplayer online game project from [[Acclaim Games]] == Music == * [[Top Secret Drum Corps]], a Swiss precision drum corps * [[Top Secret (song)|"Top Secret" (song)]], a song by F.T. Island * ''Top Secret'', an album by [[Captain Jack (band)|Captain Jack]] * "Top Secret", a song by Hangry & Angry from ''[[Sadistic Dance (album)|Sadistic Dance]]'' * "Top Secret", a song by Namie Amuro from ''[[Play (Namie Amuro album)|Play]]'' * "Top Secret", a song by Ratt from ''[[Detonator (album)|Detonator]]'' == Other uses == * [[Top Secret (B-29)|''Top Secret'' (B-29)]], a B-29 Superfortress modified to carry the atomic bomb in World War II * ''[[Himitsu – Top Secret]]'', a Japanese manga * [[Top Secret (radio program)|''Top Secret'' (radio program)]], a 1950-51 American program on the [[NBC Red Network]] * ''Top Secret'', a children's novel by [[John Reynolds Gardiner]] == See also == * {{Intitle|Top Secret}} {{disambig}}
